thread.title: Sydney weather: City marks hottest month ever with every site setting records
thread.title_full: Sydney weather: City marks hottest month ever with every site setting records

author: Peter Hannam
title: Sydney weather: City marks hottest month ever with every site setting records
text:
US confirms refugee resettlement US confirms refugee resettlement 
The US has revealed just how many refugees housed in Australia's offshore detention centres it will resettle, but only after conducting extreme vetting. More videos The world is moving closer to catastrophic peril, scientists say 
Scientists have moved the hands of their metaphorical 'Doomsday' clock closer to midnight, warning of the increasing threats of nuclear weapons and climate change. 
The city's mean temperatures averaged 25.6 degrees in January - beating a high mark set in January 1991 by half a degree - and exceeding the long-run norm by 3.3 degrees. 
It was also the highest temperature for any month in Sydney, and follows the hottest year set in 2016. Related Content The charts that show just how hot it was in 2016 
"Record-high numbers of warm nights and the equal-fewest cool days were recorded at Sydney Observatory Hill, while stations in western Sydney experienced record numbers of 40-degree days," the bureau said in its monthly report. 
While the city had its heat spikes - such as two days when 45.1 degrees were recorded at Badgerys Creek and Penrith Lakes, respectively - the month was also marked by its consistently mild nights. Advertisement 
During January, the mercury remained above 20 degrees for 25 nights, the most on record and almost triple the average of nine such nights. Meanwhile, 11 days topped 30 degrees at Observatory Hill, compared with the long-run norm of three such days. 
(See chart below of the mean maximum anomalies for January, with NSW particularly warm.) SHARE
